description: At 651 Yonge St, just south of Bloor St., the CAA Theatre is in the heart of downtown Toronto, within walking distance of the boutiques and galleries of Yorkville, the fashionable shopping of Bloor West and Church Street, the Royal Ontario Museum and the campus of University of Toronto. Parking is available in municipally owned surface lots on Isabella St. (just south of the theatre) and Charles Street (just to the north) and indoor lots off Charles, just west of Yonge.

reviews.title: Beware when buying upper balcony mezzanine seats
text: I came here to see Chicago with my sister The show was good Good dancing story singing etc
My only complaint is that if you are seated at the back of the upper balcony it is very difficult to see the details of the show
The seats at this level should be much much cheaper than they are as you cannot make out the facial expressions or any details

reviews.title: Enjoyable visit
text: Vised to see Lasting Impressions in 3D: The Magic of The Impressionists. Nice enough theatre, which was easy to find and conveniently located for public transport and places to eat. As for the show itself, although the first half was very interesting, the second half when the 3D visuals kicked in was incredible. It really was like being inside the paintings. Very impressive.

reviews.title: The subtlety of 'Us/Them' at Mirvish's CAA Theatre (thru 3/15/20)
text: Often we expect theatre - especially new works - to exaggerate for effect. Not Us/Them. Its impact comes from its subtlety. The actors play children and perfectly reveal the built-in defences children have against extreme conditions. Children do not explore the root causes or histories of events or look for meaning. They react spontaneously and morally without relying on theories, research or analysis to underpin their instinct. It undervalues children's resources to call these characters victims or survivors.

reviews.title: CAA Theatre Toronto
text: This theatre is a terrific venue for the majority of the brilliant Off-Mirvish productions that play there. The seats are comfy with great leg room. The staff are cheery, hospitable and attentive to the patrons who attend.

reviews.title: Best night of live musical theatre I have ever seen.
text: Fantastic show. Louise Pitre is phenomenal. It was a very emotional, funny, musical. Incredible performances.

reviews.title: Piaf/Dietrich - Outstanding !
text: This was our first time to the CAA Theatre. All Staff were very friendly and helpful. A smaller Lobby area made for a little more congestion before show and during intermission but patrons were considerate to each other. Louise Pitre and Jayne Lewis were both outstanding in their respective roles, especially Pitre in the difficult portrayal of Piaf. A wonderful performance altogether !

reviews.title: Nice, small theatre.  But view of the stage from the first row of balcony is partially blocked by lights!!
text: When buying tickets for a performance, theatre-goers should be made aware of lighting apparatus which blocks full view of the stage in some productions.  Or the tickets in the first row should be reduced in price.

reviews.title: CAA theatre.
text: An excellent venue to see a show! We had an amazingly big experience st Piaf/Dietrich. If you get the opportunity, do not miss it!

reviews.title: Piaff/Dietrich
text: After having attended a performance last week, Girl of the North, I was hesitant to go out into the cold weather once again to watch what I feared might be another tepid, boring and frankly unintelligible performance.  Well, I am very glad we attended Piaff/Dietrich.  The show was simply electrifying.  Both leads were astounding in several categories including acting and of course singing.  A totally convincing story of their relationship with a wonderful reprise of important songs of the era.  Perfect character development along with a compelling story led to a well-deserved standing ovation!
Don't miss seeing this show.

reviews.title: Piaf/Dietrich- don’t miss it
text: Fabulous lead actresses – very emotional performances. Draws the audience right  in. I had trouble not crying at the end.

reviews.title: Amazing show!!
text: I highly recommend this show to everyone, even if you didn't know them before. The theatre is beautiful and the tables on the stage are a great experience too. Awesome actresses, music... well done! :)

text: An amazing show, exquisite in each and every moment, very emotional and memorable. Congratulations to the entire production tea! Really an extraordinary event!!♥️♥️♥️

reviews.title: Tight quarters, uncomfortable seats, but nice intimate feel appropriate for Piaf/ Dietrich.
text: We sat in first balcony and couldn’t see the faces of performers. The theatre is quite small. Would recommend orchestra seats which were the same price. This theatre reminds me of some off Broadway theatres. Nearby parking at 20 Charles St E.

reviews.title: Piaf/ Dietrich
text: I enjoyed the show as it brought me back to my days in Paris as a university student. The story line was entertaining and the two female leads were fantastic!! Bravo! Encore!!

reviews.title: Excellent venue and show

reviews.title: Piaf/Dietrich  A Spectacular Show!
text: Edith Piaf played by Louise Pitre and Marlene Dietrich played by Jayne Lewis were outstanding!!  They both played the roles so well that I was transported back in time!!!!!
It was a perfect play for the smaller theatre.

reviews.title: Performances were awesome. But BAD lighting and BAD seats.
text: Saw a great performance of Piaf/Dietrich. But the theatre was cramped and felt cold. Lighting was aimed at the audience more then the stage. Seats were uncomfortable (not deep enough). Felt claustophobic trying to exit - took 20 minutes to get from the front of the theatre, would hate to see what happens here in case of an evacuation.

reviews.title: Nice theater, terrible seats.
text: I loved the show (Piaf/Dietrich) at the CAA Theatre. The seats were very uncomfortable, in fact, I still have a sore back

reviews.title: Divas reincarnated
text: Excellent staging, impressive recreation of each singer, poignant stories.  My wife's conclusion, "I could see it again!"

reviews.title: Fabulous venue. Intimate--perfect for the staging of Piaf/Dietrich.
text: I loved this theatre. The only issue is the parking as it is not easy to find spaces. I recommend parking in the Manual Bldg. across from it. A short walk from there. And there are dearth of good restaurants close by as well.  But this venue is more intimate than some others in the city and proved to be ideal for the production of Piaf/Dietrich in every way.  The play itself was outstanding with stellar performances from  all involved, particularly the two leading woman. They captured the nuances, mannerisms, emotions of both characters they were playing. The singing was amazing and Piaf, played by Louis Petrie was bang on in terms of her singing 'stances, hand movements, cadence, emotions and she held the end note of each number just as Piaf did. It was uncanny. . I was mesmerized by her performance. She personified 'la petite mome' perfectly. Her ability to show both the strength of Piaf's artistry, as well as her vulnerability especially as she succumbed to her addiction. Even her hands took on the visible demonstration of Piaf's decline. And not to be forgotten or minimized is the incredible performance of  Jane Lewis who played Dietrich. Her mannerisms, voice, inflections, and incredible costuming all lent credibility and depth to her portrayal  of this famous star.  The staging and efficient use of a rather small stage was unique and clever and lent a seamless air to the various transitions. The music chosen was spot on!  The closing number brought my husband and I to tears.  And the standing ovation was a testament to the fabulous performances.

reviews.title: Piaf/Dietrich . . . Brilliant, an oustanding musical
text: Brilliant storytelling of two famous songstresses who where also good friends . . . perhaps a backstory you didn't know.  The singing and acting is as good as it gets, might even bring a tear to your eye in a couple of places plus lots of smiles.  Catch it over the holidays as it ends its run in early January.  Check Mirvish for tickets.

reviews.title: Piaf/Dietrich Play
text: The play was outstanding and Louise Petrie’s performance as Edith Piaf was incredible. Some sight lines not great from 2nd row balcony.

reviews.title: Piaf/Dietrich
text: Fantastic show, and profiles well described  in the program to give background on these 20th century chanteuses. Thoroughly enjoyed my loge seat which gave excellent view of stage as well as of the entire theatre. Bonus is the location of the CAA theatre, near many restaurants, of which our choice was The Artful Dodger on Isabella. Highly recommend performance, venu and restaurant!

reviews.title: Piaf/Dietrich is fantastic
text: The 2 singers who star do a great job conveying the contrasting characters. It is a very interesting story and the music is so well done that I am going to see if I can find a Piaf music and lyrics book (with some translations!).

reviews.title: Dietrich and piaf
text: Beautiful performances throughout. Very moving and visually appealing. Lead characters acted with strong emotional performance.  Played their character well.

reviews.title: Amazingly talented women!
text: It’s incredible to see two people, not only act like the original stars, but also sing like them!  Great show!

reviews.title: It was excellent show, both leading actresses performed amazingly well, acting singing.
text: Within 2 hours of the show we can see the lives of two famous singers, their close relationships and strong friendship, love to music and greatful songs. The most I liked was the song La Vie en Rose, performed by both actresses.

reviews.title: Fantastic Show
text: Superb staging and outstanding acting/singing! For a small theatre the acoustics were splendid. Only one word to the wise, don’t book seats AA1or AA2 Loges seats as they have an obstructive view of the stage. We had to move in order to view the show. The staff were very pleasant, accommodating and apologetic. All in all, a wonderful performance and very entertaining.

reviews.title: Lovely intimate theatre
text: The Piaf Dietrich production was excellent. Louise Pitre was brilliant in her role as Piaf. I very much enjoyed the venue as there are no bad seats and it is small.

reviews.title: Piaf Dietrich
text: Outstanding play and outstanding venue.  Very intimate theatre.  Have seen numerous productions there and have never been disappointed.  No bad seats.  Great acoustics.

reviews.title: No bad seats in this small theatre
text: It feels like the audience is part of the play, especially for Piaf and Detrick (sp?) I like the intimate feeling. As well I have no difficulty hearing as I sometimes do at the Mirvish Theatre.

reviews.title: Piaf Dietrich
text: Good production, entertaining. Capable cast even though historical liberties were taken. The Piaf renditions of songs seemed more accurate than the Dietrich sound. However the Dietrich wit was there. Very enjoyable and competent musicians accompanying the duo.

reviews.title: Intimate theatre, fantastic play (Piaf/Dietrich).
text: The theatre itself is fine but not flashy by any stretch of the imagination. Saw Piaf/Dietrich here and was blown away by the feeling of being “there”, whether it was New York or Paris. Loge seats were perfect for overlooking the stage and not missing a single movement. The performances by both leading ladies were outstanding. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: A magical production - felt like we were in Paris!
text: Beautiful theatre, and amazing actors that took us back in time to the days of Piaf and Dietrich! Loved the set and the inventive costume changes. Amazing! Music and vocals were professional and authentic.

reviews.title: A fine, intimate theatre experience
text: The theatre itself is a nice size with comfortable seats.  We were in Row P, Orchestra Left and still had good sight lines to the stage. We saw the marvellous "Piaf/Dietrich" show. However, the exterior is unattractive and the lobby is very tiny and unappealing.  A bonus for CAA members is free coatcheck and coffee-a nice touch.  I believe the elevators are new since my previous visit so that made it easier to get to the washrooms although the line was very long for the ladies at intermission and some people gave up.

reviews.title: Great place
text: Just a BEAUTIFUL place to see a show.Any seat is wonderful.Great location on Younge St.So many places to get food.A MUST GO

reviews.title: Excellent Romantic and Touching Evening
text: Dynamic performances by two wonderful musical performers.  The audience loved it. Both women were outstanding and I  believe anyone who loves the songs that  Piaf and Dietrich used to sing would really enjoy this show.
